spec.name: Thomas I Archeological Site
spec.description: One of the most significant archaeological sites in Morocco and North Africa, famous for the 1969 discovery of a human half-mandible. It is now renowned for yielding the oldest Homo Erectus remains in North Africa, dating back over 500,000 years. The site was recognized as a National Material Patrimony in 1951.

links.title: Hominid Cave at Thomas Quarry I (Casablanca, Morocco): Recent findings and their context
